page.title: 13SUTTON CLOUGH.
page.content: Sutton Clough is part of what used to be the estate belonging to Sutton Hall,now demolished.It is reached by passing under a majestic stone archway formerly the Lodge.The gateway is still inhabited. The entrance to the Clough is by a narrow wooden bridge over a small stream which runs into Sutton Beck and eventually joins the River Aire. Trees rise up tall on either side of the path which follows the stream upwards towards its source.The path is in the valley bottom and the sides rise up very steeply towards Ellers Lane on one side and West lane on the other. At Clough Head,the path takes the form of an ornate metal bridge over the stream and then winds steeply up the hillside to emerge on West Lane.
